Table 1:
Responsibilities
Employees & Users, and Role Management
You will have employees join and leave your company, from the Employees & Users area; you can manage your employees and employee type (user license), security role, and details. It is important to understand the security roles as these determine what the users can see and do in Eptura Asset. Data Imports
When you have a large amount of new assets, logs, or meter readings, inventory, or vendors, manually entering them into the platform one by one is a time-consuming task. Imports can help you cut down on manual entry by using a template that has already been generated for you. Module Settings
Each module has various settings, and many of these are defined during implementation. You have the ability to adjust the settings, however, be aware that this will affect all users of Eptura Asset. Below is a high-level overview of the settings:
Assets - General (status) - Category Settings (class, category, sub-category, custom fields) - Makes and Models
Work Orders - General (settings, lookup, require reset logs etc - Workflow - Work Type (general, custom fields) - Service Task (task and task group) - Vendor Work (Vendor Work Order Form)
Inspections - Defaults - Operator Companion App - Work Order Tie - Work Order Defaults - New Inspections Defects Option
Requests - General (Status, custom fields) - Email request
Inventory - Defaults, Barcode Labels, List setup, Custom fields
Purchase Orders - Defaults, Barcode Labels, List setup, Custom fields
Contact - Employee (custom fields), Vendor (custom fields), Customer (custom fields)
Business Intelligence - Upload file report, manage folders and permissions
Invoices - General, List Setup, Custom fields - Invoice Workflow - Estimate Workflow - Service Task (task and task group)
Assets and Work Orders
Explore the modules that are highly used:
Assets module - ​The asset data includes keeping an up-to-date inventory, providing financial information on leased versus owned equipment, and retaining information about contracts, warranties, and insurance, as well as information about the configurations and capabilities of each machine. This module makes it easy to track the utilization of assets and achieve optimal use of them. Work Order module - When you understand your work orders, then you can track what is being worked on, who is doing the work, and track the costs involved. The better data you provide, the more we can help you anticipate your maintenance needs in the future. Business Intelligence (BI) Reports
Create reports and dashboards, define permissions, and schedule a report.

Inventory
Explore the module to learn how to track your parts and supplies - your consumables, that are used to repair and maintain your assets. Inventory Import
When you have a large amount of new inventory, manually entering them into the platform one by one is a time-consuming task. Imports can help you cut down on manual entry by using a template that has already been generated for you. Cycle Counts and Transfers
Explore the modules that are used:
Cycle counts are used to audit your inventory levels. Transfers are used to move inventory from one warehouse to another if a part you require is in stock at another warehouse. Work Companion

Explore this module to learn how purchase orders can help you have greater control of your inventory management and parts warehousing needs. Business Intelligence (BI) Reports
